Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ هَجَرَ شَهْوَتَهُ وَبَاعَ دُنْيَاهُ بِآخِرَتِهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who forsakes his lust and sells his world for his Hereafter

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ تَوَرَّعَ عَنِ الذُّنُوبِ وَتَنَزَّهَ عَنِ الْعُيُوبِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who abstains from sins and keeps himself free from faults

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ عَصَى هَوَاهُ فِي طَاعَةِ رَبِّهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who opposes his vain desire in obedience to his Lord

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ غَلَبَ هَوَاهُ وَلَمْ يَبِعْ آخِرَتَهُ بِدُنْيَاهُ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who overcomes his vain desire and does not sell his Hereafter for his [temporary life in this] world

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ [الْكَامِلُ‏] مَنْ قَمَعَ هَوَاهُ بِعَقْلِهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who subdues his vain desire with his intellect

Wisdom: حَقٌّ عَلَى الْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يَقْهَرَ هَوَاهُ قَبْلَ ضِدِّهِ
enWisdom: It is a right upon the intelligent one to vanquish his vain desire before his adversary

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ عَقَلَ لِسَانَهُ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who fetters his tongue

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ لَا يَتَكَلَّمُ إِلَّا بِحَاجَتِهِ أَوْ حُجَّتِهِ [وَ لَا يَشْتَغِلُ إِلَّا بِصَلَاحِ آخِرَتِهِ‏]
enWisdom: The intelligent person does not speak except when he needs to or in order to present his case

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ عَقَلَ لِسَانَهُ إِلَّا عَنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who fetters his tongue except from the remembrance [and extolment] of Allah

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ صَانَ لِسَانَهُ عَنِ الْغِيبَةِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who guards his tongue from backbiting

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ يَطْلُبُ الْكَمَالَ الْجَاهِلُ يَطْلُبُ الْمَالَ
enWisdom: The intelligent one seeks perfection, the ignorant one seeks wealth

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ تَغَمَّدَ [تَعَمَّدَ] الذُّنُوبَ بِالْغُفْرَانِ [بِالْكُفْرَانِ‏]
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who covers up sins with forgiveness

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ أَحْسَنَ صَنَائِعَهُ وَوَضَعَ سَعْيَهُ فِي مَوَاضِعِهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who performs acts of kindness and puts his effort in its correct place

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ إِذَا سَكَتَ فَكَرَ وَإِذَا نَطَقَ ذَكَرَ وَإِذَا نَظَرَ اعْتَبَرَ
enWisdom: When the intelligent one is quiet, he reflects and when he speaks, he remembers [and extols Allah] and when he observes, he takes lesson

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ زَهِدَ فِي دُنْيَا فَانِيَةٍ دَنِيَّةٍ [دَنِيَّةٍ فَانِيَةٍ] وَرَغِبَ فِي جَنَّةٍ سَنِيَّةٍ خَالِدَةٍ عَالِيَةٍ [عَلِيَّةٍ]
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who abstains from [the pleasures of] the lowly, perishing world and desires the sublime, everlasting, lofty Paradise

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ وَضَعَ الْأَشْيَاءَ مَوَاضِعَهَا وَالْجَاهِلُ ضِدُّ ذَلِكَ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who puts things in their right places, and the ignorant one does the opposite of this

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ إِذَا عَلِمَ عَمِلَ وَإِذَا عَمِلَ أَخْلَصَ وَإِذَا أَخْلَصَ اعْتَزَلَ
enWisdom: The intelligent person acts when he knows and when he acts, he does so sincerely, and when he becomes sincere, he secludes himself [from others]

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ يَجْتَهِدُ فِي عَمَلِهِ وَيُقَصِّرُ مِنْ أَمَلِهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person strives in his work and shortens his hopes

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ لَا يَفْرُطُ بِهِ عُنْفٌ وَلَا يَقْعُدُ بِهِ ضَعْفٌ
enWisdom: The intelligent one is neither pushed to the extreme by violence nor is he hampered by weakness

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ يَمْلِكُ نَفْسَهُ إِذَا غَضِبَ وَإِذَا رَغِبَ وَإِذَا رَهِبَ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who controls himself when he gets angry, when he desires and when he is frightened

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ يَتَقَاضَى نَفْسَهُ بِمَا يَجِبُ عَلَيْهِ وَلَا يَتَقَاضَى [غَيْرَهُ‏] لِنَفْسِهِ بِمَا يَجِبُ لَهُ
enWisdom: The intelligent person charges himself with performing that which is obligatory upon him and he does not charge himself with seeking that which is due to him

Wisdom: الْعَقْلُ إِنَّكَ تَقْتَصِدُ فَلَا تُسْرِفُ وَتَعِدُ فَلَا تُخْلِفُ وَإِذَا غَضِبْتَ حَلُمْتَ
enWisdom: Intelligence is for you to be moderate and not indulge in extravagance, to promise and not to break your promise, and to be forbearing when you get angry

Wisdom: الْعَقْلُ أَنْ تَقُولَ مَا تَعْرِفُ وَتَعْمَلَ بِمَا تَنْطِقُ بِهِ
enWisdom: Intelligence is for you to speak [only] of what you know and to act upon what you say

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ لَا يُضِيعُ لَهُ نَفْسَاً فِيمَا لَا يَنْفَعُهُ وَلَا يَقْتَنِي مَا لَا يَصْحَبُهُ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who does not waste his [time and] energy in that which does not benefit him, and does not [strive to] acquire that which will not accompany him [after his death]

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ غَلَبَ نَوَازِعَ أَهْوِيَتِهِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who overpowers his contending vain desires

Wisdom: الْعَاقِلُ مَنْ سَلَّمَ إِلَى الْقَضَاءِ وَعَمِلَ بِالْحَزْمِ
enWisdom: The intelligent person is one who submits to the decree [of Allah] and acts with judiciousness [and determination]

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْعَاقِلَ لَا يَنْخَدِعُ لِلطَّمَعِ
enWisdom: Verily the intelligent one is not beguiled by covetousness

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْعَاقِلَ مَنْ عَقْلُهُ فِي إِرْشَادٍ [فِي ارْتِيَادٍ] وَمَنْ رَأْيُهُ فِي ازْدِيَادٍ فَلِذَلِكَ رَأْيُهُ سَدِيدٌ وَفِعْلُهُ حَمِيدٌ
enWisdom: Verily the intelligent person is one whose intellect is [employed] in right guidance and whose view is in [the process of development and] growth, that is why his view is correct and his action praiseworthy

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْعَاقِلَ يَتَّعِظُ بِالْأَدَبِ وَالْبَهَائِمَ لَا تَتَّعِظُ إِلَّا بِالضَّرْبِ
enWisdom: Indeed, the intelligent one learns through discipline while the beasts are not trained except by beating

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْعَاقِلَ يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يَحْذَرَ الْمَوْتَ فِي هَذِهِ الدَّارِ وَيُحْسِنَ لَهُ التَّأَهُّبَ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَصِلَ إِلَى دَارٍ يَتَمَنَّى فِيهَا الْمَوْتَ فَلَا يَجِدُهُ
enWisdom: Verily it behoves the intelligent one to be cautious of death in this world, and he should make good preparations before he arrives at the abode wherein one wishes for death but does not find it

Wisdom: حَقٌّ عَلَى الْعَاقِلِ الْعَمَلُ لِلْمَعَادِ وَالِاسْتِكْثَارُ مِنَ الزَّادِ
enWisdom: It is a right that is due on the intelligent one to work for the Hereafter and to seek more provisions [for it]

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا اللَّبِيبُ مَنِ اسْتَسَلَّ [مَنِ اسْتَلَ‏] الْأَحْقَادَ
enWisdom: Only he is intelligent who takes out the grudges [from his heart]

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْبَصِيرُ مَنْ سَمِعَ فَفَكَرَ وَنَظَرَ فَأَبْصَرَ وَانْتَفَعَ بِالْعِبَرِ
enWisdom: Indeed the perceptive person is one who listens and then ponders, sees then reflects, and derives benefit from examples

Wisdom: ثَلَاثَةٌ تَدُلُّ عَلَى عُقُولِ أَرْبَابِهَا الرَّسُولُ وَالْكِتَابُ وَالْهَدِيَّةُ
enWisdom: Three things show the intelligence of their lords: the messenger, the message and the gift

Wisdom: حَقٌّ عَلَى الْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يَسْتَدِيمَ الِاسْتِرْشَادَ وَيَتْرُكَ الِاسْتِبْدَادَ
enWisdom: It behooves the intelligent one to continuously seek the right path and abandon obstinacy

Wisdom: رَغْبَةُ الْعَاقِلِ فِي الْحِكْمَةِ وَهِمَّةُ الْجَاهِلِ فِي الْحَمَاقَةِ
enWisdom: The desire of an intelligent person is in wisdom and the ambition of an ignorant person is in foolishness

Wisdom: كُلُّ عَاقِلٍ مَغْمُومٌ
enWisdom: Every intelligent person is sorrowful (or sad)

Wisdom: كُلُّ عَاقِلٍ مَحْزُونٌ
enWisdom: Every intelligent person is sorrowful (or sad)

Wisdom: لِلْعَاقِلِ فِي كُلِّ عَمَلٍ إِحْسَانٌ
enWisdom: For the intelligent one, there is goodness in every action [he does]

Wisdom: لِلْعَاقِلِ فِي كُلِّ كَلِمَةٍ نُبْلٌ
enWisdom: For the intelligent one, there is nobility in every word [he speaks]

Wisdom: لِلْعَاقِلِ فِي كُلِّ عَمَلٍ ارْتِيَاضٌ
enWisdom: For the intelligent one, in every action there is self-discipline

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لِلْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يَكُونَ شَاخِصاً إِلَّا فِي ثَلَاثٍ حَظْوَةٍ فِي مَعَادٍ أَوْ مَرَمَّةٍ لِمَعَاشٍ أَوْ لَذَّةٍ فِي غَيْرِ مُحَرَّمٍ
enWisdom: It is not for the intelligent one to move out [of his home] except for three things: to do something to improve his Hereafter, or to earn his livelihood, or to enjoy what is not forbidden

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِلْعَاقِلِ أَنْ يُخَاطِبَ الْجَاهِلَ مُخَاطَبَةَ الطَّبِيبِ الْمَرِيضَ
enWisdom: It behoves an intelligent person to address an ignorant one like a doctor addresses a sick patient

Wisdom: سِتَّةٌ تُخْتَبَرُ بِهَا عُقُولُ النَّاسِ الْحِلْمُ عِنْدَ الْغَضَبِ وَالصَبْرُ عِنْدَ الرَّهَبِ وَالْقَصْدُ عِنْدَ الرَّغَبِ وَتَقْوَى اللَّهِ فِي [عَلَى‏] كُلِّ حَالٍ وَحُسْنُ الْمُدَارَاةِ وَقِلَّةُ الْمُمَارَاةِ
enWisdom: There are six situations in which the intellects of people are tested: association, transaction, authority, isolation, affluence and poverty
